Managing Blog Posts

Blog posts are a powerful way to share your content, news, and updates with your audience. Each post can include rich text content, images, and metadata to help with organization and discovery.

Post Settings

Title

The main headline of your blog post. This appears at the top of the post and in preview cards across your site. Make it:

  • Engaging and descriptive
  • Clear about the post's content
  • Optimized for search engines (aim for 50-60 characters)

Description

A brief preview of your post that appears in blog listings and search results. Write 1-2 compelling sentences that:

  • Summarize the main point of your article
  • Entice readers to click through
  • Include relevant keywords naturally

Featured Image

The main visual for your post that appears:

  • At the top of the post
  • In preview cards across your site
  • When sharing on social media Use high-quality, relevant images that capture attention and support your content.

URL Slug

The unique portion of the URL for this post. For example, in "yoursite.com/posts/my-first-post", "my-first-post" is the slug.

  • Use lowercase letters and hyphens
  • Keep it short but descriptive
  • Include relevant keywords when possible
  • Avoid special characters

Content

The main body of your post, supporting rich text formatting including:

  • Headings and subheadings
  • Paragraphs with formatting (bold, italic, etc.)
  • Links to other content
  • Bulleted and numbered lists
  • Images and media

Author

Select the team member who wrote the post. This helps:

  • Give credit to your writers
  • Build authority for your content
  • Allow readers to find more posts by the same author

Publishing Options

  • Draft: Work on the post privately
  • In Review: Submit for team review
  • Published: Make the post public
  • Schedule: Set a future publication date and time

Best Practices for Blog Posts

Writing Tips

  • Start with a strong opening paragraph
  • Use subheadings to break up long content
  • Keep paragraphs short (3-4 sentences)
  • Include relevant internal and external links
  • End with a clear conclusion or call to action

SEO Considerations

  • Include your main keyword in the title
  • Use descriptive alt text for images
  • Write naturally for your audience
  • Link to related content on your site
  • Use appropriate heading hierarchy

Image Guidelines

  • Choose relevant, high-quality featured images
  • Optimize images for web performance
  • Use consistent image sizes
  • Include descriptive alt text
  • Consider image placement within content
